trans-unit.source: Updatable result sets in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> can be updated by using result set update methods (<codeph>updateRow()</codeph>, <codeph>deleteRow()</codeph>, and <codeph>insertRow()</codeph>), or by using positioned update or delete queries.

seg-source.mrk: Updatable result sets in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> can be updated by using result set update methods (<codeph>updateRow()</codeph>, <codeph>deleteRow()</codeph>, and <codeph>insertRow()</codeph>), or by using positioned update or delete queries.

target.mrk: Updatable result sets in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> can be updated by using result set update methods (<codeph>updateRow()</codeph>, <codeph>deleteRow()</codeph>, and <codeph>insertRow()</codeph>), or by using positioned update or delete queries.

trans-unit.source: Both scrollable and non-scrollable result sets can be updatable in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: Both scrollable and non-scrollable result sets can be updatable in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

target.mrk: Both scrollable and non-scrollable result sets can be updatable in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: If the query which was executed to create the result set is not updatable, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> will downgrade the concurrency mode to <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_READ_ONLY</codeph>, and add a warning about this on the <codeph>ResultSet</codeph>. The compilation of the query fails if the result set cannot be updatable, and contains a <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> clause.

seg-source.mrk: If the query which was executed to create the result set is not updatable, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> will downgrade the concurrency mode to <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_READ_ONLY</codeph>, and add a warning about this on the <codeph>ResultSet</codeph>.
The compilation of the query fails if the result set cannot be updatable, and contains a <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> clause.

target.mrk: If the query which was executed to create the result set is not updatable, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> will downgrade the concurrency mode to <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_READ_ONLY</codeph>, and add a warning about this on the <codeph>ResultSet</codeph>.
The compilation of the query fails if the result set cannot be updatable, and contains a <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> clause.

trans-unit.source: Positioned updates and deletes can be performed if the query contains <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> or if the concurrency mode for the result set is <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: Positioned updates and deletes can be performed if the query contains <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> or if the concurrency mode for the result set is <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph>.

target.mrk: Positioned updates and deletes can be performed if the query contains <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> or if the concurrency mode for the result set is <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: To use the result set update methods, the concurrency mode for the result set must be <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph>. The query does not need to contain <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> to use these methods.

seg-source.mrk: To use the result set update methods, the concurrency mode for the result set must be <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph>.
The query does not need to contain <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> to use these methods.

target.mrk: To use the result set update methods, the concurrency mode for the result set must be <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph>.
The query does not need to contain <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> to use these methods.

trans-unit.source: Updatable cursors lock the current row with an update lock when positioned on the row, regardless of isolation level. Therefore, to avoid excessive locking of rows, only use concurrency mode <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph> or the <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> clause when you actually need to update the rows. For more information about locking, see <xref href="cdevconcepts36402.dita">Types and scope of locks in Derby systems.</xref>

seg-source.mrk: Updatable cursors lock the current row with an update lock when positioned on the row, regardless of isolation level.

Therefore, to avoid excessive locking of rows, only use concurrency mode <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph> or the <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> clause when you actually need to update the rows.
For more information about locking, see <xref href="cdevconcepts36402.dita">Types and scope of locks in Derby systems.</xref>

target.mrk: Updatable cursors lock the current row with an update lock when positioned on the row, regardless of isolation level.

Therefore, to avoid excessive locking of rows, only use concurrency mode <codeph>ResultSet.CONCUR_UPDATABLE</codeph> or the <codeph>FOR UPDATE</codeph> clause when you actually need to update the rows.
For more information about locking, see <xref href="cdevconcepts36402.dita">Types and scope of locks in Derby systems.</xref>
